revised_title: Chromogranin A, Dopamine β-Hydroxylase, and Secretion from the Adrenal Medulla
tldr: This article discusses the subcellular and macromolecular aspects of synaptic transmission in the adrenal medulla. It focuses on chromogranin A, dopamine β-hydroxylase, and the secretion process. The authors provide insights into the storage vesicles, proteins, and enzymes involved in the release of catecholamines in response to neural stimulation, offering a model for neurotransmitter release at synapses.
